text: Oh good to hear! I tend to procrastinate a lot as well :smiley: I am quite excited to study psychology at uni now, and canâ€™t wait to learn about all these new things
Yeah i will definitely try both of the techniques in terms of writing notes down:+1::skin-tone-3:

I am excited for you! Psychology is definitely an amazing field that is at the root of everything in life as the best thing we can do as human beings is to learn about ourselves and this then helps us to achieve anything else in life :smiley: Plus the recent years the development in psychological studies has been so huge that it's certainly a field it will only gain further and further interest and attention as time goes by

Going back to the skills we were discussing before, a fun thing to do to develop them even further would be in your everyday life with friends or family to practice when they come to you with problems they want to discuss.. And when you start paying attention consciously and observe yourself you can edit your approach as you see fit to have a better connection when listening and tuning to other people :blush: And therefore you'll start feeling more confident talking about your amazing skills when applying for the psychology degree as it will come naturally to you :slightly_smiling_face:
Feel free to ask me anything else you want, I'd be happy to help with whatever else concerns you or you want to know or discuss :relaxed:
